FILE: cm365452v11.0.txt
DYAD: RUSSIA/USSR - GHANA
RIVALRY: RIV994
DISPUTE(S): MID1807 

PSNOTES: 

PS-LAST-CHANGED: 20180920 
PS-LAST-CHECKED: 20180920

Territorial-Maritime-Boundary Issues Variables

MID1807 

TERRMID: MID1807 3 -- not territory 
TERRMID-CER: MID1807 1 -- certain 
TERRMID-NOTES: 

TERRLINK: MID1807 3 -- not third party link to territory 
TERRLINK-CER: MID1807 1 -- certain 
TERRLINK-NOTES: 

MARITMID: MID1807 3 -- not maritime 
MARITMID-CER: MID1807 1 -- certain 
MARITMID-NOTES: MID1807 from Gibler 2018, Ghana seized Soviet trawlers in its territorial waters. The Soviets fiercely protested and relations deteriorated thereafter. Coded not maritime because there is no maritime border to dispute between these two states. 

ISLMID: MID1807 3 -- not islands 
ISLMID-CER: MID1807 1 -- certain 
ISLMID-NOTES: 

CIVWARMID: MID1807 3 -- not civil war 
CIVWARMID-CER: MID1807 1 -- certain 
CIVWARMID-NOTES:

CIVWARLINK: MID1807 3 -- not civil war link 
CIVWARLINK-CER: MID1807 1 -- certain 
CIVWARLINK-NOTES: 

COUPMID: MID1807 3 -- not coup 
COUPMID-CER: MID1807 1 -- certain 
COUPMID-NOTES: MID1807 this MID occurred a year after a coup in Ghana produced a regime that was less friendly toward the Soviets than the previous regime. That coup was not connected to the events of this MID, however. 

COUPLINK: MID1807 3 -- not coup link
COUPLINK-CER: MID1807 1 -- certain 
COUPLINK-NOTES: 

RIVNOTES: 

NARRATIVE-CM:
Ghana naval ships seized two Soviet fishing vessels and 52 crew in Ghanian territorial waters on October 10, 1968. The Ghanian government released the Soviet fishing vessels and 40 crew members on March 3, 1969.

SOURCES-CM: 
*Facts on File*, March 6-12, 1969.

NARRATIVE-CR:

SOURCES-CR:

SOURCES: Gibler, D.M. 2018. Militarized Interstate Dispute Narratives, 1816-2010. Langham, MD: Rowman and Littlefield.
